Welcome to REST API’s documentation!¶

REST API Main¶

REST API Main¶

This script is the entry point for the My Contacts App. It sets up the FastAPI application, includes routers, and runs the UVicorn server.

Usage:

Run this script to start the My Contacts App server.

Configuration:

Make sure to configure settings in the ‘core.config’ module.

REST API database Models¶

class app.database.models.Contact(**kwargs)¶

Bases: Base

Database model representing a contact.

Attributes:

id (int): Contact’s unique identifier. first_name (str): First name of the contact. last_name (str): Last name of the contact. email (str): Email address of the contact. phone_number (str): Phone number of the contact. birthday (Date): Birthday of the contact. avatar (str): URL to the contact’s avatar image. additional_data (str): Additional data about the contact. user_id (int): ID of the associated user.

additional_data¶
avatar¶
birthday¶
email¶
first_name¶
id¶
last_name¶
phone_number¶
user_id¶
class app.database.models.User(**kwargs)¶

Bases: Base

Database model representing a user.

Attributes:

id (int): User’s unique identifier. email (str): Email address of the user. hashed_password (str): Hashed password of the user. confirmed (bool): Indicates if the user’s email is confirmed. refresh_token (str): Refresh token for the user’s authentication. contacts (relationship): Relationship to the user’s contacts.

contacts¶
email¶
hashed_password¶
id¶

REST API repository Repositories¶

class app.repository.repositories.UserRepository(db: Session)¶

Bases: object

Repository class for managing user data.

confirmed_email(email: str) → None¶

Mark a user’s email as confirmed.

Parameters:

email (str) – User’s email.

create_user(user: UserCreate)¶

Create a new user.

Parameters:

user (UserCreate) – User data.

Returns:

Created user.

Return type:

User

get_user_by_email(email: str)¶

Retrieve a user by email.

Parameters:

email (str) – User’s email.

Returns:

User with the given email.

Return type:

User or None

update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Update a user’s refresh token.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – User to update.

  • token (str or None) – Refresh token.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

REST API services Auth¶

class app.services.auth_manager.AuthManager¶

Bases: object

Manages authentication-related operations.

Attributes:

SECRET_KEY (str): Secret key for encoding and decoding JWT tokens. ALGORITHM (str): Algorithm used for encoding and decoding JWT tokens. ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRE_MINUTES (int): Expiration time for access tokens in minutes. oauth2_scheme (OAuth2PasswordBearer): OAuth2 password bearer scheme for token extraction. pwd_context (CryptContext): Password hashing context.

ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRE_MINUTES = 30¶
ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'your-secret-key'¶
create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: int = 30)¶

Create an access token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Data to encode in the token.

  • expires_delta (int) – Expiration time for the token in minutes.

Returns:

Access token.

Return type:

str

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

Create an email verification token.

Parameters:

data (dict) – Data to encode in the token.

Returns:

Email verification token.

Return type:

str

create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: int = 7)¶

Create a refresh token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Data to encode in the token.

  • expires_delta (int) – Expiration time for the token in days.

Returns:

Refresh token.

Return type:

str

decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶
get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Get the current user based on the access token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – Access token.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

Current user.

Return type:

User

get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

Get the email from an email verification token.

Parameters:

token (str) – Email verification token.

Returns:

Email address.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid.

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

Generate a hashed password from a plain password.

Parameters:

password (str) – Plain password.

Returns:

Hashed password.

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

Verify a plain password against a hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – Plain password to verify.

  • hashed_password (str) – Hashed password to compare against.

Returns:

Whether the password is verified.

Return type:

bool

verify_token(token: str)¶

Verify and decode a JWT token.

Parameters:

token (str) – JWT token to verify.

Returns:

Decoded token payload.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid.

async app.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

REST API routes Auth¶

api.routers.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Confirm the user’s email using a confirmation token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – Email confirmation token.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

Confirmation message.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If verification fails or an error occurs.

api.routers.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Log in a user and issue an access token.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – OAuth2 password request form containing username and password.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

Token model containing access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user is not found or the provided credentials are invalid.

api.routers.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Refresh an access token using a refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – HTTP authorization credentials containing the refresh token.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

Token model containing updated access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

Raises:

HTTPException – If the refresh token is invalid or an error occurs.

api.routers.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Request email confirmation.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – RequestEmail model containing the email.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks manager.

  • request (Request) – HTTP request.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

Confirmation message or email sending status.

Return type:

dict

api.routers.auth.signup(user: UserCreate, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Sign up a new user.

Parameters:

  • user (UserCreate) – User information for sign up.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks manager.

  • request (Request) – HTTP request.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

Created user and success message.

Return type:

UserResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user already exists or an error occurs during sign up.

REST API routes Contacts¶

api.routers.contacts.create_new_contact(contact: ContactCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Create a new contact.

Parameters:

  • contact (ContactCreate) – Contact information.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – Current user.

Returns:

Created contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If an error occurs during contact creation.

api.routers.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Delete a contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – Current user.

Returns:

None (for a successful delete operation).

Return type:

None

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found or an error occurs during deletion.

api.routers.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – Current user.

Returns:

Retrieved contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found or an error occurs during retrieval.

api.routers.contacts.read_contacts(skip: int = Query(0), limit: int = Query(10), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a list of contacts with pagination.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – Number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of contacts to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – Current user.

Returns:

List of contacts.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

Raises:

HTTPException – If an error occurs during contact retrieval.

api.routers.contacts.update_contact_details(contact_id: int, contact_update: ContactUpdate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Update contact details by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to update.

  • contact_update (ContactUpdate) – Updated contact information.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – Current user.

Returns:

Updated contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found or an error occurs during update.
